summary.p: The Kantapurāṇam is one of the major Tamil texts about the god Skanda/Murukaṉ. It is the work of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār (14th century?).

The text is incomplete. The manuscript contains: Pāyiram, Uṟpattikkāṇṭam, Acurakāṇṭam (up to Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam, verse 66, itself incomplete) in U3; Makēntirakāṇṭam, Viravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam (up to verse 8, itself incomplete) in U4. Note that the Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam is not named as such in the manuscript, but is divided into 3 chapters: Kupēraceyap Paṭalam (U3, f161r, lm), Akkiṉiceyap Paṭalam (U3, f163r, lm), Yamaṉ Ceyap Paṭalam (U3, f164r, lm).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (October 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

Uṟpattiyarkāṇṭam
tikaṭa cakkarac cemmuka maintuḷāṉ
cakaṭa cakkarat tāmarai nāyaka
ṉakaṭa cakkara viṉmaṇi yāvuṟai
vikaṭa cakkaraṉ meyppatam pōṟṟuvām – 1 –
kaṭavuḷ vāḻttup paṭalam
tiruvanta tollaip puvaṉattoṭu tēvar pōṟṟip
mēṟṟicai nirutimēl viraivi
ṉ ēkiṉāṉ – 8 – yamaṉ ceyappaṭalamuṟṟum – Āka ceyyuḷ – 855 –
nirutiyum iḵtelām nēṭi yāmivaṟp
poruvatum ariyatāṟ pōri yaṟṟiṉum
varutiṟaThe manuscript stops abruptly here at the very end of the page.

lg.l: Intira ṉāti yāṉa vamararum eṉai yōrum
koḷ curaṉ ṟaṉpāl vīramā mayēnti rattuc
ceṉṟiṭa viṭuttum yāraic cepputi eṉṉa lōṭu
naṉṟeṉa vataṉai nāṭi nāṉmuka ṉavilanaviṟa is expected luṟṟāṉ – 7 –
